reviewText: This Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature contains the teen flicks Teen Witch (1989) and the Heavenly Kid (1985). It is a two disc set (so each movie comes on its own disc).Possible Spoilers:Teen Witch--starring Robyn Lively and Zelda Rubinstein. Louise (Lively) has a huge crush on the most popular boy in school; of course, he doesn't even know she exists. On her 16th birthday she gets the surprise of her life--she is told by a local witch (Rubinstein) that she is actually a descendent of the Salem witches and will now receive her powers. Can she get her crush to love the real her, or will he, like every other guy, just fall under her spell? This double sided disc contains both full screen and widescreen presentations of the film. Extras: Theatrical Trailer.The Heavenly Kid--starring Jason Gedrick, Lewis Smith, and Jane Kaczmarek. Lenny Barnes (Gedrick) is a nerdy high school kid. Out of nowhere, a foul-mouthed angel Bobby Fantana (Smith) shows up to make Lenny the most popular kid in school. Lenny learns the hard way that popularity is not all it seems and Bobby has some things to learn as well. Widescreen. Extras: none.I have fond memories of both of the movies in this set. Teen Witch was a constant rental at my house and I probably watched The Heavenly Kid a dozen times on T.V. over the years. Definitely recommended.
Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: Takes me back to the 80's. Hadn't seen The Heavenly Kid in AGES. Love Teen Witch!!!!  (I need words to finish this post. done!)

Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: Teen Witch (which I already owned) is paired with The Heavenly Kid in this duo.  Both are great 80's films for what they are.  Teen Witch is about a gawky, geeky female teen who discovers she is a Witch and her journey in learning a growth as well as the hazards of having all of ones wishes granted.  After we get what we want do we really want it?  The Heavenly Kid is about a youth who dies in a stupid racing accident and finds himself stuck in a sort of limbo until given the chance to help a young lad to over-come his own teen angst and learn along the way.  But just who is teaching whom?  This one is a great, sentimental movie.  It is not a classic or earth shattering super-film but both are good time passers with delightful stories.

Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: Two great movies with awesome soundtracks. Good actors, decent direction, feel good plots. I miss the teen movies of the 80's. Not great cinema but enjoyable and not reliant on the flash and mirrors of the current films. These movies are good for a Saturday afternoon on a bad winters day. sit down, have fun and enjoy the experience. Sort of like eating rice cakes.
Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: I bought this DVD, and I have to admit that I haven't watched Teen Witch yet. But The Heavenly Kid was great. DVD quality is pretty good, and the movie is just as I remember it. It's a funny 80s movie with a creative story. I also enjoyed laughing at the styles of the true 80s. Over all a fun film.Warning:  The 80s were more laid back and not as uptight as today. There is an implied sex scene (doesn't show anything), and there is teenage drinking, smoking, and some drug use. (But all were pretty accurate and true to the time).
Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: Hubby talked me into buying this two disc movie at Walmart. I didn't know what movies they were. After watching them at home I realized I've seen Teen Witch. It is a cutie movie. I like the dance in the locker room and the rap the shy girl sang to the rapping teens. This is a really good movie.I've never seen Heavenly Boy before buying it. I thought it was pretty good and funny. What a trip to be an angel for a young boy who ends up being the son of your ex girlfriend. And to top it off, he is your son all along. I think it would have been better if the boy found out the angel was his dad. But they didn't go that way.
Title: Totally Awesome 80s Double Feature: Teen Witch / The Heavenly Kid

reviewText: "its gulash!" one of my favorite lines from that movie. teen witch is super cheesy with extra cheese.  people breaking into hip hop battles between eachother out of nowhere, the whole side head scrunchy wearing tu tu (though it seems the tu tu thing has been coming back over the past year) wearin glitz and glamour wanna be the most popular girl 80s bit.teen witch is about a not so popular girl in school who discovers shes a witch and joins forces with the funny little old lady from poltergeist (Run to the light Carol Anne! Theres peace in the light!) and uses her powers to become the most popular girl partly in hopes to win over her dream guy.  despite it being on the the corniest films of its time its also one of the funniest and is sure to win anyone over. i give it 5 stars for fun and humor. that and for the crazy funny old lady with the squeeky voice from poltergeist. she made this movie for me.
summary: classic 80s movie. i love teen witch
